00028 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00029 from PyQt4.QtGui import *
00030 
00031 from Koo.Common import Icons
00032 from Koo.Common import Calendar
00033 from Koo.Common import Numeric
00034 from Koo.Common import Common
00035 
00036 #
00037 # We store the pointer to the Tiny ModelGroup on QModelIndex.internalPointer
00038 # Fields order should be handled using QHeaderView
00039 #
00040 # Qt.UserRole returns the model id (database id) for the given field (QModelIndex),
00041 # though id() function is also provided for convenience.
00042 
00043 
00044 ## @brief The KooModel class provides a QAbstractItemModel wrapper around 
00045 # RecordGroup class.
00046 #
00047 # To use this class, simply call setRecordGroup() to set the RecordGroup
00048 # instance to wrap, and setFields() with the fields to load.
00049 # Then it's ready to be used in any Qt model/view enabled widget such as 
00050 # QTreeView or QListView.
00051 # Note that by default KooModel is read-only.
00052 class KooModel(QAbstractItemModel):
00053         
00054         # Modes
00055         TreeMode = 1
00056         ListMode = 2
00057 
00058         # Extra roles appended to UserRole
00059         
00060         # IdRole: Returns model id of the given field
00061         IdRole = Qt.UserRole 
00062         # ValueRole: Returns the QVariant of the appropiate type
00063         # for the field. For example, date fields are returned as
00064         # QDate inside QVariant, instead of a QString as Qt.DisplayRole
00065         # does. It's been created for the Calendar view but others
00066         # might benefit too.
00067         ValueRole = Qt.UserRole + 1 
00068 
00069         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00070                 QAbstractItemModel.__init__(self, parent)
00071                 self.group = None
00072                 self.fields = {}
00073                 self.icon = ''
00074                 self.iconField = ''
00075                 self.child = ''
00076                 self.childField = ''
00077                 self.mode = self.TreeMode
00078                 self.colors = {}
00079                 self.showBackgroundColor = True
00080                 self._readOnly = True
00081                 self._updatesEnabled = True
00082                 # visibleFields is an alphabetically sorted list of 
00083                 # all visible fields. This means it discards self.icon
00084                 # and self.child fields. The list is updated using
00085                 # updateVisibleFields().
00086                 self.visibleFields = []
00087                 
00088         ## @brief Sets the RecordGroup associated with this Qt Model
00089         #
00090         # Fields should already be set and can't be added after this 
00091         # call
00092         def setRecordGroup(self, group):
00093                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modelAboutToBeReset()') )
00094                 if self.group:
00095                         self.disconnect( self.group, SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), self.recordsInserted )
00096                         self.disconnect( self.group, SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'), self.recordChanged )
00097                         self.disconnect( self.group, SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), self.recordsRemoved )
00098                         
00099                 self.group = group
00100                 if self.group:
00101                         self.connect( self.group, SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), self.recordsInserted )
00102                         self.connect( self.group, SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'), self.recordChanged )
00103                         self.connect( self.group, SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), self.recordsRemoved )
00104                         
00105                 # We emit modelReset() so widgets will be notified that 
00106                 # they need to be updated
00107                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modelReset()') )
00108                 self.updateVisibleFields()
00109 
00110         ## @brief Returns the current RecordGroup associated with this Qt Model
00111         def recordGroup(self):
00112                 return self.group
00113 
00114         ## @brief Sets the model as read-only.
00115         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00116                 self._readOnly = value
00117 
00118         ## @brief Returns whether the model is read-only or read-write.
00119         def readOnly(self):
00120                 return self._readOnly
00121 
00122         def recordsInserted(self, start, end):
00123                 if self._updatesEnabled:
00124                         self.reset()
00125                         #self.emit( SIGNAL('rowsAboutToBeInserted(QModelIndex,int,int)'), QModelIndex(), start, end ) 
00126                         #self.emit( SIGNAL('rowsInserted(QModelIndex,int,int)'), QModelIndex(), start, end ) 
00127 
00128         def recordChanged(self, record):
00129                 if not record:
00130                         return
00131                 leftIndex = self.indexFromId( record.id )
00132                 if not leftIndex.isValid():
00133                         self.reset()
00134                         return
00135                 rightIndex = self.index( leftIndex.row(), self.columnCount() - 1 )
00136                 self.emit( SIGNAL('dataChanged(QModelIndex,QModelIndex)'), leftIndex, rightIndex )
00137 
00138         def recordsRemoved(self, start, end):
00139                 if self._updatesEnabled:
00140                         self.reset()
00141                         #self.emit( SIGNAL('rowsAboutToBeRemoved(QModelIndex,int,int)'), QModelIndex(), start, end ) 
00142                         #self.emit( SIGNAL('rowsRemoved(QModelIndex,int,int)'), QModelIndex(), start, end ) 
00143                 
00144         ## @brief Sets the dictionary of fields that should be loaded
00145         def setFields(self, fields):
00146                 self.fields = fields
00147                 self.updateVisibleFields()
00148 
00149         ## @brief Sets the order in which fields should be put in the model.
00150         #
00151         # If this function is never called fields are put in alphabetical
00152         # order.
00153         def setFieldsOrder(self, fields):
00154                 self.visibleFields = fields
00155                 self.updateVisibleFields()
00156 
00157         ## @brief Sets the dictionary of colors
00158         #
00159         # The dictionary is of the form 'color' : 'expression', where 
00160         # 'expression' is a python boolean expression that will be passed
00161         # to the model, and thus can use model context information.
00162         def setColors(self, colors):
00163                 self.colors = colors
00164 
00165         ## @brief Sets whether the background color should be returned in 
00166         # data() or not.
00167         #
00168         # Setting this to True (default) will make the call to data() with 
00169         # Qt.BackgroundRole to return the appropiate background color 
00170         # if fields are read only or required.
00171         def setShowBackgroundColor(self, showBackgroundColor):
00172                 self.showBackgroundColor = showBackgroundColor
00173 
00174         ## @brief Sets that the contents of field 'icon' are used as an icon
00175         # for field 'iconField'
00176         #
00177         # The contents (usually an icon name) of the field 'icon' is used for
00178         # the decoration role of 'iconField'
00179         def setIconForField(self, icon, iconField):
00180                 self.icon = icon
00181                 self.iconField = iconField
00182                 self.updateVisibleFields()
00183 
00184         ## @brief Sets that the children of field 'child' are used as an children 
00185         # for field 'childField'
00186         def setChildrenForField(self, child, childField):
00187                 self.child = child
00188                 self.childField = childField
00189                 self.updateVisibleFields()
00190 
00191         # Updates the list of visible fields. The list is kept sorted and icon
00192         # and child fields are excluded if they have been specified.
00193         def updateVisibleFields(self):
00194                 if not self.visibleFields:
00195                         self.visibleFields = self.fields.keys()[:]
00196                 if self.icon in self.visibleFields:
00197                         del self.visibleFields[self.visibleFields.index(self.icon)]
00198                 if self.child in self.visibleFields:
00199                         del self.visibleFields[self.visibleFields.index(self.child)]
00200 
00201         ## @brief Set the model to the specified mode
00202         #
00203         # mode parameter can be TreeMode or ListMode, this is not %100
00204         # necessary in most cases, but it also avoids some checks in many cases
00205         # so at least it can provide some speed improvements.
00206         def setMode(self, mode):
00207                 self.mode = mode
00208 
00209         ## @brief Returns the model id corresponding to index
00210         def id(self, index):
00211                 if not self.group:
00212                         return 0
00213                 if not index.isValid():
00214                         return 0
00215 
00216                 model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00217                 if model:
00218                         return model.id
00219                 else:
00220                         return 0
00221 
00222         # Pure virtual functions from QAbstractItemModel
00223 
00224         def rowCount(self, parent = QModelIndex()):
00225                 if not self.group:
00226                         return 0
00227 
00228                 # In list mode we will consider there are no children
00229                 if self.mode == self.ListMode and parent.isValid() and parent.internalPointer() != self.group:
00230                         return 0
00231 
00232                 if parent.isValid():
00233                         # Check if this field has associated the children of another one
00234                         field = self.field( parent.column() )
00235                         if field == self.childField:
00236                                 fieldType = self.fieldTypeByName(self.child, parent.internalPointer())
00237                                 if fieldType in ['one2many', 'many2many']:
00238                                         value = self.valueByName(parent.row(), self.child, parent.internalPointer())
00239                                         return value.count()
00240                                 else:
00241                                         return 0
00242 
00243                         # If we get here it means that we return the _real_ children
00244                         fieldType = self.fieldType( parent.column(), parent.internalPointer() )
00245                         if fieldType in ['one2many', 'many2many']:
00246                                 value = self.value( parent.row(), parent.column(), parent.internalPointer() )
00247                                 return value.count()
00248                         else:
00249                                 return 0
00250                 else:
00251                         return self.group.count()
00252 
00253         def columnCount(self, parent = QModelIndex()):
00254                 if not self.group:
00255                         return 0
00256 
00257                 # In list mode we consider there are no children
00258                 if self.mode == self.ListMode and parent.isValid() and parent.internalPointer() != self.group:
00259                         return 0
00260 
00261                 # We always return all visibleFields. If the element should have no children then no
00262                 # rows will be returned. This way we avoid duplication of calculations.
00263                 return len(self.visibleFields)
00264 
00265         def flags(self, index):
00266                 defaultFlags = QAbstractItemModel.flags(self, index)
00267                 if 'sequence' in self.fields:
00268                         defaultFlags = defaultFlags | Qt.ItemIsDropEnabled
00269                         if index.isValid():
00270                                 defaultFlags = defaultFlags | Qt.ItemIsDragEnabled
00271 
00272                 field = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00273                 if self._readOnly or ( 'readonly' in field and field['readonly'] ):
00274                         return defaultFlags
00275                 else:
00276                         return defaultFlags | Qt.ItemIsEditable
00277 
00278         def setData(self, index, value, role):
00279 
00280                 if role != Qt.EditRole:
00281                         return True
00282                 model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00283                 field = self.field( index.column() )
00284                 fieldType = self.fieldType( index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00285 
00286                 if fieldType == 'boolean':
00287                         model.setValue( field, value.toBool() )
00288                 elif fieldType == 'float':
00289                         model.setValue( field, value.toDouble()[0] )
00290                 elif fieldType == 'integer':
00291                         model.setValue( field, value.toInt()[0] )
00292                 elif fieldType == 'selection':
00293                         value = unicode( value.toString() )
00294                         modelField = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00295                         for x in modelField['selection']:
00296                                 if x[1] == value:
00297                                         model.setValue( field, x[0] )
00298                 elif fieldType in ('char', 'text'):
00299                         model.setValue( field, unicode( value.toString() ) )
00300                 elif fieldType == 'date':
00301                         model.setValue( field, Calendar.dateToStorage( value.toDate() ) )
00302                 elif fieldType == 'datetime' and value:
00303                         model.setValue( field, Calendar.dateTimeToStorage( value.toDateTime() ) )
00304                 elif fieldType == 'time' and value:
00305                         model.setValue( field, Calendar.timeToStorage( value.toTime() ) )
00306                 elif fieldType == 'float_time' and value:
00307                         model.setValue( field, Calendar.timeToStorage( value.toTime() ) )
00308                 elif fieldType == 'many2many':
00309                         m = model.value( field )
00310                         m.clear()
00311                         ids = [x.toInt()[0] for x in value.toList()]
00312                         m.preload( ids )
00313                 elif fieldType == 'many2one':
00314                         value = value.toList()
00315                         if value:
00316                                 value = [ int(value[0].toInt()[0]), unicode(value[1].toString()) ]
00317                         model.setValue( field, value )
00318                 else:
00319                         print "Unable to store value of type: ", fieldType
00320 
00321                 return True
00322 
00323         def data(self, index, role=Qt.DisplayRole ):
00324                 if not self.group:
00325                         return QVariant()
00326                 if role == Qt.DisplayRole or role == Qt.EditRole:
00327                         value = self.value( index.row(), index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00328                         fieldType = self.fieldType( index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00329                         if fieldType in ['one2many', 'many2many']:
00330                                 return QVariant( '(%d)' % value.count() )
00331                         elif fieldType == 'selection':
00332                                 field = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00333                                 for x in field['selection']:
00334                                         if x[0] == value:
00335                                                 return QVariant( unicode(x[1]) )
00336                                 return QVariant()
00337                         elif fieldType == 'date' and value:
00338                                 return QVariant( Calendar.dateToText( Calendar.storageToDate( value ) ) )
00339                         elif fieldType == 'datetime' and value:
00340                                 return QVariant( Calendar.dateTimeToText( Calendar.storageToDateTime( value ) ) )
00341                         elif fieldType == 'float':
00342                                 # If we use the default conversion big numbers are shown
00343                                 # in scientific notation. Also we have to respect the number
00344                                 # of decimal digits given by the server.
00345                                 field = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00346                                 return QVariant( Numeric.floatToText(value, field.get('digits',None) ) )        
00347                         elif fieldType == 'float_time':
00348                                 return QVariant( Calendar.floatTimeToText(value) )
00349                         elif fieldType == 'binary':
00350                                 if value:
00351                                         return QVariant( _('%d bytes') % len(value) )
00352                                 else:
00353                                         return QVariant()
00354                         elif fieldType == 'boolean':
00355                                 return QVariant( bool(value) )
00356                         else:
00357                                 if value == False or value == None:
00358                                         return QVariant()
00359                                 else:
00360                                         # If the text has several lines put them all in a single one
00361                                         return QVariant( unicode(value).replace('\n', ' ') )
00362                 elif role == Qt.DecorationRole:
00363                         if self.field( index.column() ) == self.iconField:
00364                                 model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00365                                 # Not all models necessarily have the icon so check that first
00366                                 if self.icon in model.values:
00367                                         return QVariant( Icons.kdeIcon( model.value( self.icon ) ) )
00368                                 else:
00369                                         return QVariant()
00370                         else:
00371                                 return QVariant()
00372                 elif role == Qt.BackgroundRole:
00373                         if not self.showBackgroundColor:
00374                                 return QVariant()
00375                         field = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00376                         model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00377                         # Priorize readonly to required as if it's readonly the 
00378                         # user doesn't mind if it's required as she won't be able
00379                         # to change it anyway.
00380                         if not model.isFieldValid( self.field( index.column() ) ):
00381                                 color = '#FF6969'
00382                         elif 'readonly' in field and field['readonly']:
00383                                 color = 'lightgrey'
00384                         elif 'required' in field and field['required']:
00385                                 color = '#ddddff'       
00386                         else:
00387                                 color = 'white'
00388                         return QVariant( QBrush( QColor( color ) ) )
00389                 elif role == Qt.ForegroundRole:
00390                         if not self.colors:
00391                                 return QVariant()
00392                         model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00393                         palette = QPalette()
00394                         color = palette.color( QPalette.WindowText )
00395                         for (c, expression) in self.colors:
00396                                 if model.evaluateExpression( expression, check_load=False ):
00397                                         color = c
00398                                         break
00399                         return QVariant( QBrush( QColor( color ) ) )
00400                 elif role == Qt.TextAlignmentRole:
00401                         fieldType = self.fieldType( index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00402                         if fieldType in ['integer', 'float']:
00403                                 return QVariant( Qt.AlignRight | Qt.AlignVCenter )
00404                         else:
00405                                 return QVariant( Qt.AlignLeft | Qt.AlignVCenter )
00406                 elif role == KooModel.IdRole:
00407                         model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00408                         return QVariant( model.id )
00409                 elif role == KooModel.ValueRole:
00410                         value = self.value( index.row(), index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00411                         fieldType = self.fieldType( index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00412                         if fieldType in ['one2many', 'many2many']:
00413                                 # By now, return the same as DisplayRole for these
00414                                 return QVariant( '(%d)' % value.count() )
00415                         elif fieldType == 'selection':
00416                                 # By now, return the same as DisplayRole for these
00417                                 field = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00418                                 for x in field['selection']:
00419                                         if x[0] == value:
00420                                                 return QVariant( unicode(x[1]) )
00421                                 return QVariant()
00422                         elif fieldType == 'date' and value:
00423                                 return QVariant( Calendar.storageToDate( value ) )
00424                         elif fieldType == 'datetime' and value:
00425                                 return QVariant( Calendar.storageToDateTime( value ) )
00426                         elif fieldType == 'float':
00427                                 # If we use the default conversion big numbers are shown
00428                                 # in scientific notation. Also we have to respect the number
00429                                 # of decimal digits given by the server.
00430                                 field = self.fields[self.field( index.column() )]
00431                                 return QVariant( Numeric.floatToText(value, field.get('digits',None) ) )        
00432                         elif fieldType == 'float_time':
00433                                 return QVariant( value )
00434                         elif fieldType == 'binary':
00435                                 if value:
00436                                         return QVariant( QByteArray.fromBase64( value ) )
00437                                 else:
00438                                         return QVariant()
00439                         elif fieldType == 'boolean':
00440                                 return QVariant( bool(value) )
00441                         else:
00442                                 if value == False or value == None:
00443                                         return QVariant()
00444                                 else:
00445                                         return QVariant( unicode(value) )
00446                 else:
00447                         return QVariant()
00448 
00449         def index(self, row, column, parent = QModelIndex() ):
00450                 if not self.group:
00451                         return QModelIndex()
00452                 if parent.isValid():
00453                         # Consider childField
00454                         field = self.field( parent.column() )
00455                         if field == self.childField:
00456                                 field = self.child
00457 
00458                         value = self.valueByName( parent.row(), field, parent.internalPointer() )
00459                         return self.createIndex( row, column, value )
00460                 else:
00461                         return self.createIndex( row, column, self.group )
00462 
00463         def parent(self, index):
00464                 if not self.group:
00465                         return QModelIndex()
00466                 if not index.isValid():
00467                         return QModelIndex()
00468                 if self.mode == self.ListMode:
00469                         return QModelIndex()
00470 
00471                 # Search where in the grandparent our parent is
00472                 group = index.internalPointer()
00473 
00474                 # We don't want to go upper the model we've been given.
00475                 if group == self.group:
00476                         return QModelIndex()
00477 
00478                 # The 'parent' of the child RecordGroup is a Model. The
00479                 # model has a pointer to the RecordGroup it belongs and
00480                 # it's called 'group'
00481                 model = group.parent
00482                 parent = group.parent.group
00483 
00484                 if not parent.recordExists( model ):
00485                         # Though it should not normally happen, when you reload 
00486                         # in the main menu we receive calls in which the model
00487                         # is not in the list.
00488                         return QModelIndex()
00489 
00490                 row = parent.indexOfRecord( model )
00491                 for x, y in model.values.items():
00492                         if y == group:
00493                                 field = x
00494                                 break
00495 
00496                 # Consider childField
00497                 if field == self.child:
00498                         field = self.childField
00499 
00500                 # We check if the field is in the visibleFields. This can happen
00501                 # if the user forgot to set ListMode and there are children (or parents)
00502                 # of different types, so related models don't have the same
00503                 # fields. This crashed when browsing with the form view, but could
00504                 # happen in other places too.
00505                 if field in self.visibleFields:
00506                         column = self.visibleFields.index(field)
00507                         return self.createIndex( row, column, parent )  
00508                 else:
00509                         return QModelIndex()
00510 
00511         def mimeTypes(self):
00512                 return QStringList( [ 'text/plain' ] )
00513 
00514         def mimeData(self, indexes):
00515                 data = QMimeData()
00516                 d = []
00517                 for index in indexes:
00518                         if index.column() == 0:
00519                                 d.append( self.id( index ) )
00520                 data.setText( str( d[0] ) )
00521                 return data
00522 
00523         def dropMimeData(self, data, action, row, column, parent):
00524                 if action != Qt.MoveAction:
00525                         return False
00526                 if not parent.isValid():
00527                         return False
00528                 if row != -1 or column != -1:
00529                         return False
00530                 group = parent.internalPointer()
00531                 # Change record order only if the group is sorted by 'sequence' field.
00532                 # Otherwise don't even try to move it as group.sort() won't work due to
00533                 # the need to call the server and thus it'd lose changes.
00534                 # By now, when sortedField is None we consider as if it was 'sequence'
00535                 # because most views will have it as default sort field.
00536                 if group.sortedField and group.sortedField != 'sequence':
00537                         return False
00538                 record = self.recordFromIndex( parent )
00539                 seq = record.value( 'sequence' )
00540                 seq = seq or 0
00541                 if group.sortedOrder == Qt.AscendingOrder:
00542                         seq += 1
00543                 else:
00544                         seq -= 1
00545 
00546                 id = int( str( data.text() ) )
00547                 movedRecord = self.recordFromIndex( self.indexFromId( id ) )
00548                 movedRecord.setValue( 'sequence', seq )
00549                 group.records.remove( movedRecord )
00550                 group.records.insert( group.records.index(record), movedRecord )
00551                 self.reset()
00552                 return True
00553 
00554         def supportedDropActions(self):
00555                 return Qt.CopyAction | Qt.MoveAction
00556 
00557         # Plain virtual functions from QAbstractItemModel
00558 
00559         def sort(self, column, order):
00560                 self.group.sort( self.field( column ), order )
00561 
00562         def headerData(self, section, orientation, role):
00563                 if orientation == Qt.Vertical:
00564                         return QVariant()
00565                 if role == Qt.DisplayRole:
00566                         field = self.fields[ self.field( section ) ]
00567                         return QVariant( Common.normalizeLabel( unicode( field['string'] ) ) )
00568                 elif role == Qt.FontRole and not self._readOnly:
00569                         if self.group.isFieldRequired( self.field( section ) ):
00570                                 font = QFont()
00571                                 font.setBold( True )
00572                                 return QVariant( font )
00573                 return QVariant()
00574 
00575         ## @brief Returns the field name for the given column 
00576         def field(self, column):
00577                 if column >= len(self.visibleFields):
00578                         return None
00579                 else:
00580                         return self.visibleFields[column]
00581 
00582         # Note that in both fieldType() and fieldTypeByName() functions we ignore 
00583         # the 'group' parameter and use 'self.group' instead as this improves performance
00584         # as in some cases we won't force loading a record just to know a field type.
00585 
00586         ## @brief Returns the field type for the given column and group
00587         def fieldType(self, column, group):
00588                 field = self.field(column)
00589                 if field:
00590                         return self.group.fields[ field ]['type']
00591                 else:
00592                         return None
00593 
00594         ## @brief Returns the field type for the given column and group
00595         def fieldTypeByName(self, field, group):
00596                 if field in self.group.fields:
00597                         return self.group.fields[ field ]['type']
00598                 else:
00599                         return None
00600 
00601         ## @brief Returns a Record refered by row and group parameters
00602         def record(self, row, group):
00603                 if not group:
00604                         return None
00605                 # We ensure the group has been loaded by checking if there
00606                 # are any fields. modelByIndex loads on demand, but it means
00607                 # two reads to the server. So with these two lines (addFields)
00608                 # we only have performance gains they can be removed with 
00609                 # the only drawback that the server will be queried twice.
00610                 if not group.fields:
00611                         group.addFields( self.fields )
00612                 if row >= group.count():
00613                         return None
00614                 else:
00615                         return group.modelByIndex( row )
00616 
00617         ## @brief Returns the value from the model from the given row, column and group
00618         #
00619         # 'group' is usually obtained from the internalPointer() of a QModelIndex.
00620         def value(self, row, column, group):
00621                 # We ensure the group has been loaded by checking if there
00622                 # are any fields
00623                 if not group.fields:
00624                         group.addFields( self.fields )
00625                 model = self.record(row, group)
00626                 field = self.field(column)
00627                 if not field or not model:
00628                         return None
00629                 else:
00630                         return model.value( field )
00631 
00632         def setValue(self, value, row, column, group):
00633                 # We ensure the group has been loaded by checking if there
00634                 # are any fields
00635                 if not group.fields:
00636                         group.addFields( self.fields )
00637                 model = self.record(row, group)
00638                 field = self.field(column)
00639                 if field and model:
00640                         model.setValue( field, value )
00641                 
00642 
00643         def valueByName(self, row, field, group):
00644                 # We ensure the group has been loaded by checking if there
00645                 # are any fields
00646                 if not group.fields:
00647                         group.addFields( self.fields )
00648 
00649                 model = self.record( row, group )
00650                 if not model:
00651                         return None
00652                 else:
00653                         return model.value( field )
00654 
00655         ## @brief Returns the id of the model pointed by index. 
00656         #
00657         # The index can point to any field of the model.
00658         def id(self, index):
00659                 model = self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
00660                 if model:
00661                         return model.id
00662                 else:
00663                         return -1
00664 
00665         ## @brief Returns a QModelIndex pointing to the first field of a given 
00666         # a model id
00667         def indexFromId(self, id):
00668                 if not self.group:
00669                         return QModelIndex()
00670 
00671                 row = self.group.indexOfId( id )
00672                 if row >= 0:
00673                         return self.index( row, 0 )
00674                 return QModelIndex()
00675 
00676         def recordFromIndex(self, index):
00677                 return self.record( index.row(), index.internalPointer() )
